text: "You Need to Calm Down" is a song by American singer-songwriter Taylor Swift. It was released on June 14, 2019, as the second single from her seventh studio album, Lover. Swift wrote and produced the song with Joel Little. The song contains lyrics about lessening bullying and homophobia. ==Charts== ===Weekly charts=== Chart performance for "You Need to Calm Down" Chart (2019-2020) Peak position Argentina (Argentina Hot 100) 71 Bolivia (Monitor Latino) 19 China Airplay/FL (Billboard) 1 Croatia (HRT) 19 Colombia (National-Report) 69 Ecuador (National-Report) 91 Estonia (Eesti Ekspress) 8 Greece (IFPI) 6 Iceland (Tonlist) 20 Israel (Media Forest) 18 Japan (Japan Hot 100) 23 Latvia (LAIPA) 8 Lebanon (OLT20 Combined Chart) 5 Lithuania (AGATA) 8 Malaysia (RIM) 3 Mexico Ingles Airplay (Billboard) 1 Nicaragua (Monitor Latino) 14 Romania (Airplay 100) 70 Singapore (RIAS) 7 Slovenia (SloTop50) 36 US Rolling Stone Top 100 3 ===Year-end charts=== Year-end chart performance for "You Need to Calm Down" Chart (2019) Position Australia (ARIA) 61 Canada (Canadian Hot 100) 28 Portugal (AFP) 284 US Billboard Hot 100 39 US Adult Contemporary (Billboard) 36 US Adult Top 40 (Billboard) 17 US Mainstream Top 40 (Billboard) 34 US Rolling Stone Top 100 47 Chart (2020) Position US Adult Contemporary (Billboard) 36 == References == Category:Taylor Swift songs Category:2019 songs Category:Synth-pop
